name: Traverse Entity List
description: Iterates through each Entity in the input Entity List

name: Play Timed Effects
description: Plays Timed Effects at the specified World Location

name: Fixed-Point Projectile Launch
description: Spawns a Local Projectile at the specified Location in the World Coordinate System

name: Fixed-Point Displacement
description: Moves from the current Location to the Target Location Supports configuring movement duration and speed; if both are small, the movement may not reach the Target Location

name: Recover HP
description: Initiates a one-time HP restoration for the Target Entity

name: Camera Orientation Detection Data
description: Casts a ray from the Camera to the emission Location and returns the Rotation and Location of valid Targets along the path

name: Force Exit Aiming State
description: Forces the Character to exit Aiming Status if the Character is currently in it

name: Set Own Attack Target
description: Sets the Target Entity as its Attack Target

name: Trigger Hitbox at Specific Location
description: Initiates a Hitbox Attack at the specified Location in the World Coordinate System, with configurable attack parameters

name: Add Unit Status
description: Applies the Unit Status defined by the configuration ID to the Target

name: Notify Server Node Graph
description: Notifies the Server Node Graph; supports up to three String parameters At runtime, forwards logic to the Server Node Graph and triggers the \[On Skill Node Call\] Event on the Server Node Graph

name: Player Turning
description: Turns the Player using the configured turning mode

parameters.name: Turning Mode
parameters.description: Includes: Target then Input, Input Direction, Target Direction, Target then Camera, Camera Direction, Input then Target

name: Player Turns to Face Set Direction
description: Turns the Player toward the direction specified by the 3D Vector configuration

name: Modify Attack Weight
description: Edits the weight of the current Attack Target

name: Remove Unit Status
description: Removes the Unit Status corresponding to the specified configuration ID from the Target Entity

name: Remove Specified Character Disruptor Device
description: Removes the specified type of Character Disruptor Device

parameters.name: Disruptor Device Type
parameters.description: Includes: Force Field Device, Ejector, and Traction Device

name: Trigger Hitbox at Specific Location
description: Initiates a Hitbox Attack at the specified Attachment Point, with configurable attack parameters

name: Reset Skill Target
description: Resets the Skill Target and reruns the Skill selection logic to choose a new Target

name: Set Local Variable
description: Sets the value of a local variable

name: Break Loop
description: Break out of a Finite Loop. The output pin must connect to the \[Break Loop\] input parameter of the \[Finite Loop\] Node

name: Finite Loop
description: From the \[Loop Start Value\] to the \[Loop End Value\], the loop iterates, incrementing the Integer by 1 each time. On each iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to \[Loop Body\]. After a full iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to \[Loop Complete\]. Use \[Break Loop\] to end the iteration early

name: Modify the Aggro Value of the Specified Entity Proportionally
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Proportionally edits the Target Entity's Aggro Value on the specified Aggro Owner

name: Transfer the Aggro Value of the Specified Entity Proportionally
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Transfers a percentage of Aggro on the Aggro Owner from the Source Entity to the Target Entity

name: Taunt Target
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode The Taunter Entity taunts the specified Target Entity

name: Remove Target Entity From Aggro List
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Removes the Target Entity from the Aggro Owner Entity's Aggro List; this may cause the Target Entity to leave battle

name: Clear the Aggro List of the Specified Entity
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Clears the Aggro List of the specified Entity; this usually causes the Target to leave battle

name: Set the Aggro Value of the Specified Entity
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Sets the Aggro Value of the specified Entity on the Aggro Owner Entity

name: Modify the Aggro Value of the Specified Entity
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Edits the Aggro Value of the specified Entity on the Aggro Owner Entity

name: Send Signal to Server Node Graph
description: Within the skill node graph, signals can be sent to the server node graph, and all server node graphs can listen for this signal.

name: Node Parameters
description: | **Parameter Type**  | **Parameter Name** |  **Type**  | **Description** | |-----------------|----------------|--------|-------------| | Input Parameter |  Signal Name   | String |             |

name: Double Branch
description: Branches into True or False based on the evaluated condition When the Boolean is True, the \[True\] execution flow runs; when it is False, the \[False\] execution flow runs

name: Enumeration Match
description: After confirming the Enumeration type, determines whether the two input values are equal

parameters.name: Result
parameters.description: Output True if equal, False if not equal

name: Equal
description: Determines whether two inputs are equal Some Parameter Types have special comparison rules: Floating Point Numbers: Floating Point Numbers are compared using approximate equality. When the difference between two Floating Point Numbers is less than an extremely small value, the two numbers are considered equal. For example: 2.0000001 and 2.0 are considered equal 3D Vector: The x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector are compared using Floating Point approximate equality

name: Data Type Conversion
description: Converts input parameter types to another type for output. For specific rules, see [Basic Concepts](https://act.mihoyo.com/ys/ugc/tutorial//detail/mhk23ora1wom) - \[Conversion Rules Between Basic Data Types\]

name: Split 3D Vector
description: Outputs the x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector as three Floating Point Numbers

name: Orientation to Rotation
description: Converts a Direction Vector to Euler Angles

name: Multiplication
description: Performs multiplication, supporting Floating Point and Integer multiplication

name: Division
description: Performs division, supporting Floating Point division and Integer division. Integer division returns the quotient result The divisor should not be 0, otherwise it may return an illegal value

name: Arccosine Function
description: Calculates the arccosine of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Arctangent Function
description: Calculates the arctangent of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Arcsine Function
description: Calculates the arcsine of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Direction Vector to Rotation
description: Converts the Forward Vector and Upward Vector to Euler Angles

parameters.name: Forward Vector
parameters.description: Represents the desired Orientation of the Unit

parameters.name: Upward Vector
parameters.description: Defines the Unit's Up direction (used to determine the rotation angle). Default is the positive Y-axis of the World Coordinate System

name: Radians to Degrees
description: Converts radians to degrees

name: Get Random Number
description: Returns a random number in \[Lower Limit, Upper Limit\] (inclusive)

name: Addition
description: Adds two Floating Point Numbers or Integers

name: Subtraction
description: Subtracts two Floating Point Numbers or Integers

name: Degrees to Radians
description: Converts degrees to radians

name: Absolute Value Operation
description: Returns the absolute value of the input

name: Logical NOT Operation
description: Performs a logical NOT operation on the input Boolean value and returns the result

name: Logical OR Operation
description: Performs a logical OR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: Logical XOR Operation
description: Performs a logical XOR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: Logical AND Operation
description: Performs a logical AND operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: 3D Vector Normalization
description: Normalizes the length of a 3D Vector and outputs the result

name: 3D Vector Addition
description: Calculates the sum of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Angle
description: Calculates the angle between two 3D Vectors and outputs the value in degrees

name: 3D Vector Subtraction
description: Calculates the difference of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Modulo Operation
description: Calculates the magnitude of the input 3D Vector

name: 3D Vector Dot Product
description: Calculates the dot product of two input 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Zoom
description: Scales the input 3D Vector (scalar multiplication) and outputs the result

name: 3D Vector Cross Product
description: Calculates the cross product of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Rotation
description: Rotates the input 3D Vector by the Euler Angles specified by the rotation and returns the result

name: Greater Than
description: Returns whether the left value is greater than the right value

name: Greater Than or Equal To
description: Returns whether the left value is greater than or equal to the right value

name: Less Than
description: Returns whether the left value is less than the right value

name: Less Than or Equal To
description: Returns whether the left value is less than or equal to the right value

name: Cosine Function
description: Calculates the cosine of the input in radians

name: Tangent Function
description: Calculates the tangent of the input in radians

name: Sine Function
description: Calculates the sine of the input in radians

name: Create 3D Vector
description: Creates a 3D Vector from x, y, and z components

name: Assembly List
description: Assembles multiple Input Parameters of the same type (up to 100) into a single List

parameters.description: Assembles up to 100 parameters into a list

parameters.name: List
parameters.description: The assembled list

name: Node Graph Begins
description: Start event of the Skill Node Graph Used to customize the Skill logic after this Node; subsequent Nodes execute in the order defined by the Node Graph

name: Node Function
description: End Node for Boolean Local Filter Outputs True or False as the final result; applies to the referenced logic

name: Node Function
description: End Node for Integer Local Filter Outputs an Integer value as the final result; applies to the referenced logic

name: Get Corresponding Value From List
description: Returns the value at the specified ID in the List. IDs start at 0

name: Get List Length
description: Returns the length of the list (number of elements)

name: Get Maximum Value From List
description: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the maximum value

name: Get Minimum Value From List
description: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the minimum value

name: Get Ray Filter Type List
description: Assembles the required Ray Filter types into a List. Available filters include Hurtbox, Scene, and Object Self-Collision

name: Get Entity Type List
description: Assembles the required Entity types into a List. Types include Stages, Objects, Players, Characters, and Creations

name: List Includes This Value
description: Returns whether the list contains the specified value

name: Get Custom Variable
description: Returns the value of the specified Custom Variable from the Target Entity If the variable does not exist, returns the type's default value

name: Get Preset Status
description: Returns the Preset Status value of the specified Entity. Returns 0 if the Entity does not have the specified Preset Status

name: Query If Entity Is on the Field
description: Searches whether the specified Entity is present Note that Character Entities are still considered present even when Downed

name: Get Unit Attack Target
description: Returns the Target Entity that the Unit Entity is currently attacking

name: Get Target Attachment Point Location
description: Returns the Attachment Point Location corresponding to the specified Attachment Point Name on the Target Entity

name: Get Target Attachment Point Rotation
description: Returns the Attachment Point Rotation corresponding to the specified Attachment Point Name on the Target Entity

name: Get Target Entity
description: Returns the Target Entity. The meaning of this output varies depending on the functional module that references the Filter Node Graph

name: Get Entitys Type
description: Returns the type of the specified Entity

name: Get Entity Location
description: Returns the Location of the specified Entity

name: Get Entity Rotation
description: Returns the Rotation of the specified Entity in Euler Angles

name: Get Self Entity
description: Returns the Entity associated with this Node Graph

name: Filter Entity List Within Square Range
description: Filters Entities within a square range according to specified rules and a maximum count, and returns a list of Entities that meet the conditions

parameters.name: Filter Rules
parameters.description: Options: Default, Random, or Nearest-to-Farthest order

name: Filter Entity List Within Spherical Range
description: Filters Entities within a spherical range according to specific rules and a maximum count, and returns a list of Entities that meet the conditions

parameters.name: Filter Rules
parameters.description: Options: Default, Random, or Nearest-to-Farthest order

name: Query Entity by GUID
description: Searches for an Entity by GUID

name: Query Entity Faction
description: Searches Target Entity's Faction

name: Query If Faction Is Hostile
description: Searches whether Faction 1 and Faction 2 are hostile

name: Query If Self Is in Combat
description: Searches whether the Entity associated with this Node Graph has entered battle

name: Get Current Character
description: Returns the Character Entity currently controlled by this Player's client

name: Get Player Entity to Which the Character Belongs
description: Returns the Player Entity that owns the Character Entity

name: Get List of Player Entities on the Field
description: Returns a list of all Player Entities present in the scene

name: Get Character Entity of Specified Player
description: Returns the Character Entity of the specified Player Entity

name: Query GUID by Entity
description: Searches for the GUID of the specified Entity

name: Get Player Client Input Device Type
description: Returns the Player's local input device type, as determined by the Interface mapping method

parameters.name: Input Device Type
parameters.description: Includes keyboard/mouse, gamepad, touchscreen

name: Get Entity List by Unit Tag
description: Returns a list of all Entities in the scene that carry this Unit Tag

name: Get Entity's Unit Tag List
description: Returns a list of all Unit Tags carried by the Target Entity

name: Get Local Variable
description: Returns the value of a specific local variable

name: Query if Specified Entity is in Combat
description: Searches whether the specified Entity has entered battle

name: Get the Aggro List of the Specified Entity
description: Get Specific Entity's Aggro List

name: Get the Aggro Target of the Specified Entity
description: Get Aggro Target of Specific Entity

name: Get All Entities Within the Collision Trigger
description: Returns all Entities within the Collision Trigger corresponding to a specific ID in the Collision Trigger Component on the Target Entity

name: Get Ray Detection Result
description: Returns the first Target or On-Hit Location that meets the Filter criteria, ordered from nearest to farthest along the ray

parameters.name: Entity Type Filter
parameters.description: Includes Stage, Object, Player, Character, Creation

parameters.name: Hit Layer Filter
parameters.description: Options: Hurtbox, Scene, and Object Self-Collision

name: Get All Valid Entities That Are Scannable by Scan Component
description: Returns all Units carrying a Scan Component whose Filter returns True, regardless of the Unit's scannable status

name: Get Entity Currently Scanned by Scan Component
description: Returns Entities currently detected by the Scan Component; these are Entities in the Active State

name: Get Entity's Current Active Scan Tags
description: Returns the Target Entity's Current Active Scan Tags

name: Get Entity's Scan Status
description: Get Entity Scan Status

parameters.name: Scan Status
parameters.description: Options: Invisible, Current Scan Target, Candidate Target, Not Eligible

name: When Node Graph Variable Changes
description: This event is triggered when a Node Graph Variable in the current Node Graph changes The previous and current values are Generic. Determine the Generic type to correctly receive events for Node Graph Variables of the corresponding type Vessel-type Node Graph Variables do not provide before-value and after-value Output Parameters

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: The Entity associated with this Node Graph

parameters.name: Event Source GUID
parameters.description: GUID of the Entity associated with this Node Graph

parameters.name: Variable Name
parameters.description: Name of the Variable that was changed

parameters.name: Pre-Change Value
parameters.description: The Variable's value before the change

parameters.name: Post-Change Value
parameters.description: The Variable's value after the change

name: When Custom Variable Changes
description: This event is triggered when the Custom Variable of the Entity associated with the current Node Graph changes The previous and current values are Generic. Determine the Generic type before you can correctly receive events for Custom Variables of the corresponding type Vessel-type Custom Variables do not provide before-value and after-value Output Parameters

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: The Entity associated with this Node Graph

parameters.name: Event Source GUID
parameters.description: GUID of the Entity associated with this Node Graph

parameters.name: Variable Name
parameters.description: Name of the Variable that was changed

parameters.name: Pre-Change Value
parameters.description: The Variable's value before the change

parameters.name: Post-Change Value
parameters.description: The Variable's value after the change

name: When Preset Status Changes
description: This event is triggered when the Preset Status of the Entity associated with the Node Graph changes

name: When Character Movement SPD Meets Condition
description: Adds the Unit Status effect \[Monitor Movement Speed\] to the Character Entity. This event is triggered when the conditions are met

name: When Entity Is Created
description: This event is triggered when an Entity is created All types of Entities can trigger this event. Stage Entities, Character Entities, and Player Entities trigger this event when entering a Stage

name: When Entity Is Destroyed
description: This event triggers when objects and creations within the stage are destroyed. This event can only trigger on stage entities.

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: Destroyed Entity

parameters.name: Custom Variable Component Snapshot
parameters.description: On destroy, captures a snapshot of the Custom Variable component on this Entity. Use the Search Custom Variable Snapshot node to retrieve its Custom Variable values

name: When Entity Is Removed/Destroyed
description: This event is triggered when any Entity in the Stage is removed or destroyed, and it can only be triggered on Stage Entities This event is triggered upon Entity destruction or removal. Therefore, when an Entity is destroyed, it triggers both the \[On Entity Destroyed\] and \[On Entity Removed/Destroyed\] events in sequence

name: When Entity Faction Changes
description: This event is triggered when an Entity's Faction changes

name: When the Character Is Down
description: When a Character is Downed, the Node Graph on the Character Entity can trigger this event

parameters.name: Reason
parameters.description: Node Graph caused: the Character was Downed by the Destroy Entity node in the Node Graph

name: When Character Revives
description: When a Character is Revived, the Node Graph on the Character Entity can trigger this event

name: When Player Teleport Completes
description: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when the Player completes teleportation This event is also triggered when a Player enters a Stage for the first time

name: When All Player's Characters Are Down
description: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when all of the Player's Character Entities are Downed

parameters.name: Reason
parameters.description: Node Graph caused: the Character was Downed by the Destroy Entity node in the Node Graph

name: When All Player's Characters Are Revived
description: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when all of the Player's Characters are Revived

name: When Player Is Abnormally Downed and Revives
description: This event is triggered on the Player Entity when a Character is Downed and then Revived due to drowning, falling into an abyss, or similar reasons

name: When Entering Collision Trigger
description: The "Collision Trigger Source" range of a runtime entity A enters the "Collision Trigger" range of another runtime entity B Node graph events will be sent to the entity B configured with "Collision Trigger"

parameters.name: Entering Entity
parameters.description: Entity A (referenced above)

parameters.name: Trigger Entity
parameters.description: Entity B (mentioned above)

parameters.name: Trigger ID
parameters.description: The trigger with the corresponding ID in Entity B's Collision Trigger Component

name: When Exiting Collision Trigger
description: When the "Collision Trigger Source" range of active Entity A leaves the "Collision Trigger" range of active Entity B Node graph events will be sent to the entity B configured with "Collision Trigger"

parameters.name: Exiting Entity
parameters.description: Entity A (referenced above)

parameters.name: Trigger Entity
parameters.description: Entity B (mentioned above)

name: When HP Is Recovered
description: This event is triggered when an Entity's HP is restored

parameters.name: Recovery Amount
parameters.description: Actual healing amount. If the Entity had not lost any HP prior to healing, the amount is 0

name: When Initiating HP Recovery
description: This event is triggered on the initiating Entity when an Entity restores HP to other Entities

parameters.name: Recovery Amount
parameters.description: Actual healing amount. If the Target Entity had not lost any HP prior to healing, the amount is 0

name: When Attack Hits
description: This event is triggered when an Entity's attack hits other Entities

parameters.name: Damage
parameters.description: Actual damage dealt. If no damage is dealt due to Invincible or other reasons, the amount is 0

parameters.name: Elemental Attack Potency
parameters.description: Elemental Gauge in the Attack

name: When Attacked
description: This event is triggered when the Entity is attacked

parameters.name: Damage
parameters.description: Actual damage dealt. If no damage is dealt due to Invincible or other reasons, the amount is 0

parameters.name: Elemental Attack Potency
parameters.description: Elemental Gauge in the Attack

name: When Entering an Interruptible State
description: This event is triggered when an Entity is attacked and enters the Vulnerable Status

name: When Basic Motion Device Stops
description: This event is sent to the Component Owner when a Basic Motion Device on the Basic Motion Device Component completes its movement or is disabled

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: Component Owner

name: When Path Reaches Waypoint
description: When the Pathing Motion Device reaches a Waypoint, it sends this event to the Owner of the Basic Motion Device Component. This event is triggered only if "Send Event on Waypoint Arrival" is enabled in the Waypoint settings

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: Component Owner

name: When On-Hit Detection Is Triggered
description: This event is triggered when the On-Hit Detection Component's Owner hits other Entities or the Scene

parameters.name: On-Hit Hurtbox
parameters.description: If set to False: The environment was hit

parameters.name: On-Hit Entity
parameters.description: Hit Entity is only valid when a Hurtbox is hit

name: When Timer Is Triggered
description: This event is triggered when the Timer reaches the specified time node

name: When Global Timer Is Triggered
description: This event is triggered when the Global Countdown Timer reaches zero The Global Stopwatch Timer does not trigger this event

name: When UI Control Group Is Triggered
description: Only UI Controls of the Interactive Button and Item Display types trigger this event The Node Graph event "UI Control Group Triggered" is sent during Stage runtime when a UI Control Group created through an Interactive Button or an Item Display UI Control is interacted with. This event can only be received by the Node Graph of the _Player_ who triggered the interaction

parameters.name: UI Control Group Composite Index
parameters.description: If the UI control that triggered this event forms a multi-control UI group with other controls, this output parameter returns the corresponding group value

parameters.name: UI Control Group Index
parameters.description: If the triggering UI control is a single-control UI group, this value represents the ID of that UI control group

name: When Unit Status Changes
description: This event is triggered when the Stack Count of a Unit Status changes This event is triggered when Unit Status effects are applied or removed

parameters.name: Remaining Status Stacks
parameters.description: Edited Stack Count

parameters.name: Original Status Stacks
parameters.description: Previous Stack Count

parameters.name: Slot ID
parameters.description: ID of the Unit Status slot that changed

name: When Unit Status Ends
description: This event is triggered when a Unit Status is removed for any reason or when its Runtime Duration expires

parameters.name: Removal Reason
parameters.description: Status Replacement: The Unit Status was removed because it was replaced by another status

parameters.name: Slot ID
parameters.description: ID of the Unit Status slot that changed

name: When Elemental Reaction Event Occurs
description: Adds the Unit Status effect \[Monitor Elemental Reaction\] to the Entity. This event is triggered when the conditions are met

name: When Shield Is Attacked
description: Adds the Unit Status effect \[Add Shield\] to the Entity. This event is triggered when the Shield takes damage

parameters.name: Shield Value of this Unit Status Before Attack
Shield Value of this Unit Status After Attack

name: When Tab Is Selected
description: When the active tab is selected, it will send an event to the node graph The Entity Node Graph configured by the Tab Component will receive this event

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: Entity with the tab component mounted

parameters.name: Event Source GUID
parameters.description: GUID of the Entity with the tab component mounted; outputs 0 if none exists

parameters.name: Tab ID
parameters.description: The tab ID

parameters.name: Selector Entity
parameters.description: Character Entity that triggers the tab

name: When Creation Enters Combat
description: Only effective in Classic Aggro Mode This event is triggered when a Creation enters battle

name: When Creation Leaves Combat
description: Only effective in Classic Aggro Mode This event is triggered when a Creation leaves battle

name: When Player Class Level Changes
description: This event is triggered when a Player's Class Level changes and is sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in that Class's Node Graph

parameters.name: Event Source Entity
parameters.description: Active Player Entity

name: When Player Class Changes
description: This event is triggered when a Player's Class changes and is sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in the Node Graph of the new Class

name: When Player Class Is Removed
description: This event is triggered when a Player's Class is removed and sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in the Node Graph of the previous Class

name: When Skill Node Is Called
description: This event is triggered by the \[Notify Server Node Graph\] Node in the Skill Node Graph. Up to three strings can be passed in

name: When Aggro Target Changes
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Aggro Target changes This event can also be triggered when entering or leaving battle

name: When Self Enters Combat
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Entity itself enters battle

name: When Self Leaves Combat
description: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Entity itself leaves battle

name: Monitor Signal
description: Monitors Signal trigger events defined in the Signal Manager The Signal name to monitor must be selected first

parameters.name: Signal Source Entity
parameters.description: The Entity that sent this signal using the Send Signal node

name: When Deck Selector Is Complete
description: This event is triggered on the Player's Node Graph when the Player completes the Deck Selector, or when it is forcibly closed due to time constraints The output parameters report the Deck Selector's result and the corresponding reason

parameters.name: Target Player
parameters.description: Active Player Entity

parameters.name: Selection Result List
parameters.description: When a selection interaction is triggered, valid **selection results** are returned as this output parameter, and the completion reason is **Completed by Player**

parameters.name: Completion Reason
parameters.description: Six reason enumerations

parameters.name: Deck Selector Index
parameters.description: Referenced Deck Selector ID

name: When Text Bubble Is Completed
description: This event can only be mounted by Text Bubble Components and is received by the Entity's Node Graph that completed the dialogue Completion refers to when the final line of dialogue has finished playing

parameters.name: Bubble Owner Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Entity with the Text Bubble component mounted

parameters.name: Character Entity
parameters.description: Target Character of the current Bubble dialogue

parameters.name: Text Bubble Configuration ID
parameters.description: Currently active Text Bubble Config ID

parameters.name: Text Bubble Completion Count
parameters.description: Number of times the currently active Text Bubble has been fully played for this dialogue Character

name: When Selling Inventory Items in the Shop
description: This event is triggered when Inventory items are sold in the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it

name: When Custom Shop Item Is Sold
description: This event is triggered when Custom items are sold in the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it

name: When selling items to the shop
description: This event is triggered when items are purchased by the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it

name: When Equipment Is Equipped
description: This event is triggered when Equipment is equipped. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph

name: When Equipment Is Unequipped
description: This event is triggered when Equipment is unequipped. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph

name: When Equipment Is Initialized
description: When Equipment is first obtained and enters the Inventory, it is initialized. The event's output parameters return the unique ID of the Equipment instance. Use this ID to edit the Equipment dynamically. The Owner of the Equipment will receive this event. Configure this in the Item Node Graph

name: When Equipment Affix Value Changes
description: This event is triggered when Equipment Affix values change. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph

parameters.name: Affix ID
parameters.description: The corresponding ID of this Entry within the Equipment Affixes

name: When Item Is Lost From Inventory
description: This event is triggered when an Item is removed from the Inventory (its quantity becomes 0). The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it

name: When the Quantity of Inventory Item Changes
description: This event is triggered when the quantity of Items in the Inventory changes. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it

name: When Item Is Added to Inventory
description: This event is triggered when a new Item is added to the Inventory. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it. This event is not triggered by quantity-only changes

name: When the Quantity of Inventory Currency Changes
description: This event is triggered when the amount of Inventory Currency changes. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it

name: When Items in the Inventory Are Used
description: This event is triggered when an Item in the Inventory is used. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it

name: When Creation Reaches Patrol Waypoint
description: When the **Send Node Graph Event on Arrival** option is enabled for a waypoint in the Patrol template, a Node Graph Event is triggered once the specified conditions are met This Node Graph Event can only be received by the creation's node graph

parameters.name: Creation Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Creation Entity

parameters.name: Creation GUID
parameters.description: The GUID of the Creation. If it was not an initially placed Creation, the output is empty

parameters.name: Current Patrol Template ID
parameters.description: The Patrol Template ID currently active on this Creation

parameters.name: Current Path Index
parameters.description: The Path ID referenced by the Creation's currently active Patrol Template

parameters.name: Current Reached Waypoint ID
parameters.description: The Waypoint ID the Creation has currently reached

parameters.name: Next Waypoint ID
parameters.description: The Waypoint ID the Creation will move to next

name: Print String
description: Outputs a string to the log, generally used for logic checks and debugging In the log, this string prints whenever the logic runs successfully, regardless of whether this Node Graph is toggled

parameters.name: String
parameters.description: The string to be printed

name: Set Local Variable
description: When connected to the Query Node \[Get Local Variable\], this overwrites the value of that Local Variable

parameters.name: Local Variable
parameters.description: Container for data storage

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: Value used to overwrite this local variable

name: Break Loop
description: Break out of a Finite Loop. The output pin must connect to the \[Break Loop\] input parameter of the \[Finite Loop\] Node

name: Finite Loop
description: From the \[Loop Start Value\] to the \[Loop End Value\], the loop iterates, incrementing the Integer by 1 each time. On each iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to \[Loop Body\]. After a full iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to \[Loop Complete\]. Use \[Break Loop\] to end the iteration early. After exiting the loop, the logic connected to the \[Loop Complete\] node will also be executed.

parameters.name: Loop Start Value
parameters.description: Starting integer value for iteration

parameters.name: Loop End Value
parameters.description: Integer value at which the iteration ends

parameters.name: Current Loop Value
parameters.description: Integer value of the current execution logic

name: Forwarding Event

name: Start Timer
description: Start a Timer on the Target Entity The Timer is uniquely identified by its name A Timer consists of a looping or non-looping Timer Sequence. The Timer Sequence is a set of time points in seconds arranged in ascending order; when the Timer reaches these points, it triggers the \[On Timer Triggered\] event. The maximum length of a Timer Sequence is 100 For example, if you input the Timer Sequence \[1, 3, 5, 7\], the \[On Timer Triggered\] event fires at 1s, 3s, 5s, and 7s When Loop is set to "Yes," the Timer restarts from 0s after reaching the last time point. For \[1, 3, 5, 7\], it restarts from 0s after reaching 7s

parameters.name: Target Entity
parameters.description: Active Entity

parameters.name: Timer Name
parameters.description: Timer Identifier

parameters.description: If set to True, the Timer Sequence executes in a loop

For countdown timers, pausing followed by modifying the time to 0s will trigger the \[When the Global Timer Is Triggered\] event upon resuming the timer. If the timer is paused first, then modified to 0s, followed by modifying the time to increase it, and finally resumed, the \[When the Global Timer Is Triggered\] event will not be triggered.

name: Multiple Branches

parameters.name: Control Expression
parameters.description: Only supports Integers or Strings

name: Double Branch
description: Branches into True or False based on the evaluated condition When the Boolean is True, the \[True\] execution flow runs; when it is False, the \[False\] execution flow runs

name: Enumerations Equal
description: After confirming the Enumeration type, determines whether the two input values are equal

parameters.name: Result
parameters.description: Output True if equal, False if not equal

name: Assembly List
description: Assembles multiple Input Parameters of the same type (up to 100) into a single List

parameters.description: Assembles up to 100 parameters into a list

parameters.name: List
parameters.description: The assembled list

name: Equal
description: Determines whether two inputs are equal Some Parameter Types have special comparison rules: Floating Point Numbers: Floating Point Numbers are compared using approximate equality. When the difference between two Floating Point Numbers is less than an extremely small value, the two numbers are considered equal. For example: 2.0000001 and 2.0 are considered equal 3D Vector: The x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector are compared using Floating Point approximate equality

parameters.name: Result
parameters.description: Output True if equal, False if not equal

name: Data Type Conversion
description: Converts input parameter types to another type for output. For specific rules, see [Basic Concepts](https://act.mihoyo.com/ys/ugc/tutorial//detail/mhk23ora1wom) - \[Conversion Rules Between Basic Data Types\]

name: Split 3D Vector
description: Outputs the x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector as three Floating Point Numbers

name: Multiplication
description: Performs multiplication, supporting Floating Point and Integer multiplication

name: Division
description: Performs division, supporting Floating Point division and Integer division. Integer division returns the quotient result The divisor should not be 0, otherwise it may return an illegal value

name: Create 3D Vector
description: Creates a 3D Vector from x, y, and z components

name: Logarithm Operation
description: Calculates the logarithm of the argument with the specified base The base should not be negative or equal to 1, and the argument should not be negative, otherwise illegal values may be generated

name: Arccosine Function
description: Calculates the arccosine of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Arctangent Function
description: Calculates the arctangent of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Arcsine Function
description: Calculates the arcsine of the input and returns the value in radians

name: Range Limiting Operation
description: Clamps the input value to the range \[lower limit, upper limit\] (both bounds inclusive) and outputs the result  If the input falls within \[lower limit, upper limit\], returns the original value If the input is below the lower limit, returns the lower limit; if it exceeds the upper limit, returns the upper limit If the lower limit is greater than the upper limit, treats the input as invalid and returns an illegal value

name: Direction Vector to Rotation
description: Converts the Forward Vector and Upward Vector to Euler Angles

parameters.name: Forward Vector
parameters.description: Represents the desired Orientation of the Unit

parameters.name: Upward Vector
parameters.description: Defines the Unit's Up direction (used to determine the rotation angle). Default is the positive Y-axis of the World Coordinate System

name: Calculate Timestamp From Formatted Time
description: Converts a formatted time to a timestamp

name: Calculate Formatted Time From Timestamp
description: Converts a timestamp to formatted time

name: Calculate Day of the Week From Timestamp
description: Converts a timestamp to the day of the week

name: Radians to Degrees
description: Converts radians to degrees

name: Addition
description: Adds two Floating Point Numbers or Integers

name: Subtraction
description: Subtracts two Floating Point Numbers or Integers

name: Degrees to Radians
description: Converts degrees to radians

name: Take Larger Value
description: Returns the larger of two inputs

name: Take Smaller Value
description: Returns the smaller of two inputs

name: Absolute Value Operation
description: Returns the absolute value of the input

name: Distance Between Two Coordinate Points
description: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two coordinates

name: Logical NOT Operation
description: Performs a logical NOT operation on the input Boolean value and returns the result

name: Logical OR Operation
description: Performs a logical OR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: Logical XOR Operation
description: Performs a logical XOR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: Logical AND Operation
description: Performs a logical AND operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result

name: Exponentiation
description: Raises the base to the given exponent and returns the result

name: Modulo Operation
description: Returns the modulus of Input 2 and Input 1

name: Arithmetic Square Root Operation
description: Returns the arithmetic square root of the input value

name: Sign Operation
description: When the input is positive, returns 1 When the input is negative, returns -1 When the input is 0, returns 0

name: Round to Integer Operation
description: Performs a rounding operation based on the rounding method and returns the rounded positive number

parameters.name: Rounding Mode
parameters.description: Round: Rounds to the nearest integer according to standard rules

name: 3D Vector Normalization
description: Normalizes the length of a 3D Vector and outputs the result

name: 3D Vector Addition
description: Calculates the sum of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Angle
description: Calculates the angle between two 3D Vectors and outputs it in radians

name: 3D Vector Subtraction
description: Calculates the difference of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Modulo Operation
description: Calculates the magnitude of the input 3D Vector

name: 3D Vector Dot Product
description: Calculates the dot product of two input 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Zoom
description: Scales the input 3D Vector (scalar multiplication) and outputs the result

name: 3D Vector Cross Product
description: Calculates the cross product of two 3D Vectors

name: 3D Vector Rotation
description: Rotates the input 3D Vector by the Euler Angles specified by the rotation and returns the result

parameters.name: Rotate
parameters.description: This 3D input vector represents a specific rotation in Euler angles

name: Greater Than
description: Returns whether the left value is greater than the right value

name: Greater Than or Equal To
description: Returns whether the left value is greater than or equal to the right value

name: Less Than
description: Returns whether the left value is less than the right value

name: Less Than or Equal To
description: Returns whether the left value is less than or equal to the right value

name: Cosine Function
description: Calculates the cosine of the input in radians

name: Tangent Function
description: Calculates the tangent of the input in radians

name: Sine Function
description: Calculates the sine of the input in radians

name: Left Shift Operation
description: Performs a logical left shift on the input by the specified bit count and outputs the result

name: Right Shift Operation
description: Performs a logical right shift on the input by the specified bit count and outputs the result Performs an arithmetic right shift, preserving the sign bit

name: Bitwise AND
description: Performs a bitwise AND operation on the two inputs and returns the result

name: Bitwise OR
description: Performs a bitwise OR operation on the two inputs and returns the result

name: XOR (Exclusive OR)
description: Performs a bitwise XOR operation on the two inputs and returns the result

name: Bitwise Complement
description: Performs a bitwise complement operation on the input and returns the result

name: Write by bit
description: Writes the write value as a binary number to the \[start bit, end bit\] of the target value (also a binary number). The start bit is indexed from 0, and the write length includes both the start and end bits If the binary significant length of the write value (counted from the first 1 from the left) exceeds the write length, the write fails and returns the original value If the write value is negative, it also fails due to exceeding the write length (the first bit of a negative number's binary representation is the sign bit 1)

name: Read by bit
description: Reads the value from \[start bit, end bit\] of the value (in binary representation)

name: Create Dictionary
description: Creates Key-Value Pairs sequentially from the input key and value lists This node builds the Dictionary using the shorter of the key and value lists; extra items are truncated If duplicate keys are found in the key list, creation fails and returns an empty Dictionary

name: Assembly Dictionary
description: Combines up to 50 Key-Value Pairs into one Dictionary

name: Split Structure
description: Returns all parameters of the specified Structure

name: Assemble Structure
description: Combines multiple parameters into a single Structure-type value

name: Query Game Mode and Player Number
description: Searches the theoretical number of players entering the match, including players via Matchmaking or Room creation, and the method of entry

parameters.name: Gameplay Mode
parameters.description: Includes Playtest, Room Play, and Matchmaking Play

name: Get Local Variable
description: Retrieves a Local Variable and optionally sets its \[Initial Value\] After setting the \[Initial Value\], the \[Value\] output parameter will be equal to the input \[Initial Value\] When the output \[Local Variable\] is connected to the \[Set Local Variable\] Execution Node's input \[Local Variable\], the input \[Value\] of \[Set Local Variable\] overwrites this Search Node's output \[Value\]. The next time you use \[Get Local Variable\], the output \[Value\] is the overwritten value

parameters.name: Initial Value
parameters.description: Allows you to set the default initial value for local variables

parameters.name: Local Variable
parameters.description: Container for data storage

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: When not Overwritten, this value equals the Initial Value; after it is Overwritten, it equals the new value

name: Query Server Time Zone
description: Searches the Server's timezone

name: Query Timestamp (UTC+0)
description: Searches the current timestamp

name: Get Random Floating Point Number
description: Returns a random Floating Point Number that is  the lower limit and  the upper limit. The range is inclusive

name: Get Random Integer
description: Returns a random Integer that is  the lower limit and  the upper limit. The range is inclusive

name: Weighted Random
description: Takes a list of weights and randomly selects an ID based on the weight distribution For example, with a weight list {10, 20, 66, 4}, this node outputs 0, 1, 2, or 3 with probabilities 10%, 20%, 66%, and 4% respectively

name: 3D Vector: Backward
description: Return (0,0,-1)

name: 3D Vector: Zero Vector
description: Return (0,0,0)

name: 3D Vector: Forward
description: Return (0,0,1)

name: 3D Vector: Up
description: Return (0,1,0)

name: 3D Vector: Down
description: Return (0,-1,0)

name: 3D Vector: Right
description: Return (1,0,0)

name: 3D Vector: Left
description: Return (-1,0,0)

name: Pi ()
description: Returns the approximate value of  ( 3.142)

name: Search List and Return Value ID
description: Find the specified value in the list and return a list of IDs where it appears For example, if the target list is {1,2,3,2,1} and the value is 1, the returned ID list is {0,4}, meaning 1 appears at IDs 0 and 4 in the target list

parameters.name: ID List
parameters.description: Returns an empty list if not found

name: Get Corresponding Value From List
description: Returns the value at the specified ID in the list (0-based)

name: Get List Length
description: Returns the length of the list (number of elements)

name: Get Maximum Value from List
description: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the maximum value

name: Get Minimum Value From List
description: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the minimum value

name: List Includes This Value
description: Returns whether the list contains the specified value

name: Query Custom Variable Snapshot
description: Searches the value of the specified Variable Name from the Custom Variable Component snapshot Only available for the \[On Entity Destroyed\] event

name: Get Node Graph Variable
description: Returns the value of the specified Node Graph Variable from the current Node Graph If the variable does not exist, returns the type's default value

name: Get Custom Variable
description: Returns the value of the specified Custom Variable from the Target Entity If the variable does not exist, returns the type's default value

name: Get Preset Status
description: Returns the value of the specified Preset Status for the Target Entity. Returns 0 if the Entity does not have that Preset Status

name: Query Character's Current Movement SPD
description: Can only be searched when the Character has the \[Monitor Movement Speed\] Unit Status effect

name: Query If Entity Is on the Field
description: Searches whether the specified Entity is present Note that Character Entities are still considered present even when Downed

name: Get All Entities on the Field
description: Returns all Entities currently present in the scene. The number of Entities in this List may be large

name: Get Specified Type of Entities on the Field
description: Returns all Entities of the specified type currently in the scene. The number of Entities in this list may be large

parameters.name: Entity Type
parameters.description: Includes Stage, Object, Player, Character, Creation

name: Get Entities With Specified Prefab on the Field
description: Returns all Entities currently in the scene that were created by the specified Prefab ID

name: Get Character Attribute
description: Returns the Base Attributes of the Character Entity

name: Get Entity Advanced Attribute
description: Returns the Advanced Attributes of the Entity

name: Get Entity Type
description: Returns the Entity Type of the Target Entity

parameters.name: Entity Type
parameters.description: Includes Player, Character, Stage, Object, Creation.

name: Get Entity Location and Rotation
description: Returns the Location and Rotation of the Target Entity Not applicable to Player Entities or Stage Entities

name: Get Entity Forward Vector
description: Returns the Forward Vector of the specified Entity (the positive Z-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)

name: Get Entity Upward Vector
description: Returns the Upward Vector of the specified Entity (the positive Y-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)

name: Get Entity Right Vector
description: Returns the Right Vector of the specified Entity (the positive X-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)

name: Get List of Entities Owned by the Entity
description: Returns a list of all Entities owned by the Target Entity

name: Get Entity Elemental Attribute
description: Returns the Element Attributes of the Target Entity

name: Get Object Attribute
description: Returns the Base Attributes of the Object

name: Get Owner Entity
description: Returns the Owner Entity of the specified Target Entity

name: Get Entity List by Specified Range
description: Returns a list of Entities within a specified spherical range from the Target Entity List

name: Get Entity List by Specified Type
description: Returns a list of specified Entity types from the Target Entity List

parameters.name: Entity Type
parameters.description: Includes Player, Character, Stage, Object, Creation.

name: Get Entity List by Specified Prefab ID
description: Returns a list of Entities created with the specified Prefab ID from the Target Entity List

name: Get Entity List by Specified Faction
description: Returns the list of Entities belonging to a specific Faction from the Target Entity List

name: Get Self Entity
description: Returns the Entity associated with this Node Graph

name: Query GUID by Entity
description: Searches for the GUID of the specified Entity

name: Query Entity by GUID
description: Searches for an Entity by GUID

name: Query Current Environment Time
description: Searches the current Environment Time, in the range \[0, 24)

parameters.name: Current Environment Time
parameters.description: The value range is \[0, 24)

parameters.name: Current Loop Day
parameters.description: Number of Loop Days elapsed

name: Query Game Time Elapsed
description: Searches how long the game has been running, in seconds

name: Query Entity Faction
description: Searches the Faction of the specified Entity

name: Query If Faction Is Hostile
description: Searches whether two Factions are hostile to each other

name: Query If All Player Characters Are Down
description: Check if all of the player's characters are downed

name: Get Player GUID by Player ID
description: Returns the Player GUID based on Player ID, where the ID indicates which Player they are

name: Get Player ID by Player GUID
description: Returns the Player ID based on Player GUID, where the ID indicates which Player they are

name: Get Player Client Input Device Type
description: Returns the Player's local input device type, as determined by the Interface mapping method

parameters.name: Input Device Type
parameters.description: Includes keyboard/mouse, gamepad, touchscreen

name: Get Player Entity to Which the Character Belongs
description: Returns the Player Entity that owns the Character Entity

name: Get Player Revive Time
description: Returns the revive duration of the specified Player Entity, in seconds

name: Get Player Nickname
description: Returns the Player's nickname

name: Get Player Remaining Revives
description: Returns the remaining number of revives for the specified Player Entity

name: Get List of Player Entities on the Field
description: Returns a list of all Player Entities present in the scene

name: Get All Character Entities of Specified Player
description: Returns a list of all Character Entities for the specified Player Entity

name: Get Follow Motion Device Target
description: Returns the Target of the Follow Motion Device, including the Target Entity and its GUID

name: Get Current Global Timer Time
description: Returns the current time of the specified Global Timer on the Target Entity

name: Get Player's Current UI Layout
description: Returns the ID of the currently active Interface Layout on the specified Player Entity

name: Get Creation's Current Target
description: The Target Entity varies with the Creation's current behavior For example, when a Creation is attacking, its Target is the specified enemy Entity For example, when a Creation is healing allies, its Target is the specified allied Entity

parameters.name: Creation Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Creation Entity

parameters.name: Target Entity
parameters.description: Current intelligently selected Target Entity of the Creation

name: Get Aggro List of Creation in Default Mode
description: Returns the Aggro List in Classic Mode. This Node only outputs a valid list when the Aggro Configuration is set to \[Default Type\]

parameters.name: Creation Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Creation Entity

parameters.name: Aggro List
parameters.description: Unordered list of Entities this Creation currently has Aggro against

name: Get Creation Attribute
description: Returns the Attributes of the specified Creation

name: Query Player Class Level
description: Searches the Player's Level of the specified Class

name: Query Player Class
description: Searches the Player's current Class; outputs the Config ID of that Class

name: Query Character Skill
description: Searches the Skill in the specified slot of a Character; outputs that Skill's Config ID

name: List of Slot IDs Querying Unit Status
description: Searches the list of all Slot IDs for the Unit Status with the specified Config ID on the Target Entity

name: Query If Entity Has Unit Status
description: Searches whether the specified Entity has a Unit Status with the given Config ID

name: Query Unit Status Stacks by Slot ID
description: Searches the Stack Count of the specified Unit Status on the Target Entity's designated Slot

name: Query Unit Status Applier by Slot ID
description: Searches the Applier of the specified Unit Status on the Target Entity's designated Slot

name: Get Entity List by Unit Tag
description: Returns a list of all Entities in the scene that carry this Unit Tag

name: Get Entity Unit Tag List
description: Returns a list of all Unit Tags carried by the Target Entity

name: Query Global Aggro Transfer Multiplier
description: Searches the Global Aggro Transfer Multiplier; it can be configured in \[Stage Settings\]

name: Query the Aggro Multiplier of the Specified Entity
description: Query Aggro Multiplier of Specific Entity

name: Query the Aggro Value of the Specified Entity
description: Searches the Aggro Value of the Target Entity on its Aggro Owners

name: Query if Specified Entity Is in Combat
description: Searches whether the specified Entity has entered battle

name: Get List of Owners Who Have the Target in Their Aggro List
description: Searches which Entities' Aggro Lists include the specified Target Entity

name: Get List of Owners That Have the Target As Their Aggro Target
description: Searches which Entities have the Target Entity as their Aggro Target

name: Get the Aggro List of the Specified Entity
description: Get Specific Entity's Aggro List

name: Get the Aggro Target of the Specified Entity
description: Get Aggro Target of Specific Entity

name: Get Specified Waypoint Info
description: Searches the specified Waypoint information for the given Path

name: Get Preset Point List by Unit Tag
description: Searches all Preset Points that carry the Unit Tag by its ID; outputs each Preset Point's ID

name: Query Preset Point Position Rotation
description: Searches the Location and Rotation of the specified Preset Point

name: Get Player Settlement Success Status
description: Get Player Settlement Success Status

parameters.name: Settlement Status
parameters.description: Includes: Undetermined, Victory, Defeat

name: Get Player Settlement Ranking Value
description: Returns the Settlement ranking value for the specified Player Entity

name: Get Faction Settlement Success Status
description: Get Faction Settlement Success Status

parameters.name: Settlement Status
parameters.description: Includes: Undetermined, Victory, Defeat

name: Get Faction Settlement Ranking Value
description: Returns the Settlement ranking value for the specified Faction

name: Query If Dictionary Contains Specific Key
description: Searches whether the specified Dictionary contains the specified Key

name: Query If Dictionary Contains Specific Value
description: Searches whether the specified Dictionary contains the specified Value

name: Query Dictionary's Length
description: Searches the number of Key-Value Pairs in the Dictionary

name: Query Dictionary Value by Key
description: Searches the corresponding Value in the Dictionary by Key. If the Key does not exist, returns the type's default value

name: Get List of Keys from Dictionary
description: Returns a list of all Keys in the Dictionary. Because Key-Value Pairs are unordered, the Keys may not be returned in insertion order

name: Get List of Values from Dictionary
description: Returns a list of all Values in the Dictionary. Because Key-Value Pairs are unordered, the Values may not be returned in insertion order

name: Query Inventory Shop Item Sales Info
description: Searches sale information for a specified Item in the Inventory Shop

name: Query Inventory Shop Item Sales List
description: Search the inventory shop's sales list

name: Query Shop Purchase Item List
description: Search the shop's purchase list

name: Query Shop Item Purchase Info
description: Searches purchase information for a specified Item in the Shop

name: Query Custom Shop Item Sales List
description: Searches the Custom Shop sale list; the output parameter is a list of Item IDs

name: Query Custom Shop Item Sales Info
description: Searches sale information for a specified Item in the Custom Shop

name: Query Equipment Tag List
description: Searches the list of all Tags on this Equipment instance

name: Query Equipment Config ID by Equipment ID
description: Searches the Equipment Config ID by Equipment ID. The Equipment Instance ID can be obtained in the \[Equipment Initialization\] event

name: Get Equipment Affix List
description: Returns a list of all Affixes on this Equipment instance When Equipment is initialized, Affix values are randomized, so the Equipment Affixes on the Equipment instance also generate corresponding instances. Therefore, the data type is Integer rather than Config ID

name: Get Equipment Affix Config ID
description: Returns the Config ID of an Equipment Affix by its ID on the Equipment instance

name: Get Equipment Affix Value
description: Returns the value of the Affix at the specified ID on the Equipment instance

name: Get Inventory Item Quantity
description: Returns the quantity of the Item with the specified Config ID in the Inventory

name: Get Inventory Currency Quantity
description: Returns the amount of Currency with the specified Config ID in the Inventory

name: Get Inventory Capacity
description: Get Inventory Capacity

name: Get All Currency From Inventory
description: Returns all Currencies in the Inventory, including types and corresponding amounts

name: Get all basic items from Inventory
description: Returns all Basic Items in the Inventory, including Item types and their quantities

name: Get all equipment from Inventory
description: Returns all Equipment in the Inventory; the output parameter is a list of all Equipment IDs

name: Get Loot Component Item Quantity
description: Returns the quantity of Items with the specified Config ID from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab

name: Get Loot Component Currency Quantity
description: Returns the amount of Currency with the specified Config ID from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab

name: Get All Equipment from Loot Component
description: Returns all Equipment from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab

name: Get All Items from Loot Component
description: Returns all Items from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab

name: Get All Currency from Loot Component
description: Returns all Currencies from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab

name: Get All Entities Within the Collision Trigger
description: Returns all Entities within the Collision Trigger corresponding to a specific ID in the Collision Trigger Component on the Target Entity

name: Query Specified Mini-Map Marker Information
description: Searches the information of the Mini-map Marker with the specified ID in the Mini-map Marker Component on the Target Entity

parameters.name: Target Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Entity

parameters.name: Mini-Map Marker ID
parameters.description: The Mini-map Marker ID to search

parameters.name: Activation Staet
parameters.description: The active state of the searched Mini-map Marker

parameters.name: List of Players With Visible Markers
parameters.description: Returns the list of Players who can see this Marker

parameters.name: List of Players Tracking Markers
parameters.description: Returns the list of Players tracking this Marker

name: Get Entity's Mini-Map Marker Status
description: Searches the configuration and activation status of the Entity's current Mini-map Marker

parameters.name: Target Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Entity

parameters.name: Full Mini-Map Marker ID List
parameters.description: Complete list of Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity

parameters.name: Active Mini-Map Marker ID List
parameters.description: Complete list of active Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity

parameters.name: Inactive Mini-Map Marker ID List
parameters.description: Complete list of inactive Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity

name: Get Current Creation's Patrol Template
description: Returns the Patrol Template information of the specified Creation Entity

parameters.name: Creation Entity
parameters.description: Runtime Creation Entity

parameters.name: Patrol Template ID
parameters.description: The Patrol Template ID currently active on this Creation

parameters.name: Path Index
parameters.description: The Path ID referenced by the Creation's currently active Patrol Template

parameters.name: Target Waypoint Index
parameters.description: The Waypoint ID the Creation will move to next

name: Query If Achievement Is Completed
description: Searches whether the Achievement corresponding to a specific ID on the Target Entity is complete

name: Get the Currently Active Scan Tag Config ID
description: Returns the Configuration ID of the currently active Scan Tags on the Target Entity

name: Get Player Rank Score Change
description: Returns the Rank change score for the Player Entity under different Settlement states

name: Get Player Ranking Info
description: Returns the Player's Rank-related information

name: Get Player Escape Validity
description: Get Player Escape Permission

name: Get Currently Active Entity Deployment Groups
description: Searches the list of Entity Layout Groups currently active in the Stage

name: Query Corresponding Gift Box Quantity
description: Searches the quantity of the specified Gift Box on the Player Entity

name: Query Corresponding Gift Box Consumption
description: Searches the consumed quantity of the specified Gift Box on the Player Entity
